channel.title: PC Temp
channel.description:
I just downloaded speedfan to my pc, and one of the temps has a flame next to it. I have a program called care temp .99, it says core #0 is 23c and core#1 is 33c Speedfan says Temp1 27c Temp2 -78c Temp3 -128c HD1 38c Temp1 28c Core 32c *Flame*Core 64c ambient 0c
Might be worth noting, the first "core", on the chart, varies allot from like 15-35, the 2nd "core" doesn't move at all, the chart reads a constant never changing 64c.
Thoughts please?

item.title: PC Temp
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

Or maybe hes playing grid on 2fps.

Impossible to play grid at a nice framerate on cards these days and get <=43 with fans turned off. Ur talking shit imo or your sensor’s are broken.

Read full topic

item.title: PC Temp
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:14, topic:220268”]wtf… My computers cpu never goes over 40.
And my gpu never goes over 43 when the fans are turned off. (playing grid in highest detail)

I need to do some sirius overclocking.

My laptop though…
CPU 68C
HDD 40C
Thats doing nothing while running on vista. (it only has 256mb ram)[/quote]

Bullshit, 43 C with the fans off, while playing a game?

Read full topic

item.title: PC Temp
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

wtf… My computers cpu never goes over 40.
And my gpu never goes over 43 when the fans are turned off. (playing grid in highest detail)

I need to do some sirius overclocking.

My laptop though…
CPU 68C
HDD 40C
Thats doing nothing while running on vista. (it only has 256mb ram)

item.title: PC Temp
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

Hiaburi you’re temps are fine. It’s when your CPU gets over 70c and when your GPU gets 85+c you should look out for.

At my current clock speed after a 1 hour stress test with both cores on 100% usage my cpu reaches 68c and when playing crysis for an hour my GPU reaches 85c But video cards are supposed to be able to manage 100c so it’s ok.

Read full topic

item.title: PC Temp
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

hmm, well if that matters, I have a Raidmax Scorpio 868W case

item.title: PC Temp
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

Gpu would be the Graphics processing unit.

Mcp is…goes to wikipedia Media Communications Processor

I have a desktop comp, and an Antec 900 case…so I guess it wouldn’t be fair to compare temps here.

@Davidude
Do you have a fire extenquisher by your desk? XD

Read full topic

item.title: PC Temp
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

Field	Value
Sensor Properties	
Sensor Type	CPU, HDD, ACPI, nVIDIA MCP
GPU Sensor Type	Diode  (NV-Diode)
	
Temperatures	
CPU	28 °C  (82 °F)
CPU #1 / Core #1	 23 °C  (73 °F)
CPU #1 / Core #2	 32 °C  (90 °F)
MCP	61 °C  (142 °F)
GPU Diode	61 °C  (142 °F)
WDC WD400BD-75JMC0	[ TRIAL VERSION ]
WDC WD3200AAKS-00SBA0	[ TRIAL VERSION ]

So wahts gpu and mcp? and i guess those readings look ok, must be speedfan then?

Random info:
Hmm, with crysis, sandbox2, WoW, firefox, and a few other random programs and things running according to that program, it peaked at 41/47.

Read full topic

item.title: PC Temp
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

AC5 is leet. Go download everest and tell us the sensor’s Celsius then. Might be false readings.

Read full topic

item.title: PC Temp
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

Yea, the fans on and its got AC5 thermal paste on it.

item.title: PC Temp
item.dc:creator: @postmanpat9 postmanpat9
item.description:
@postmanpat9 wrote:

The heat sensors on the 2nd core are probably fucked if its a core2duo a lot of those have faulty sensors, and the varying temps on core1 are going from idle to under load maybe? have a double check and make sure the cpu fan is plugged in and that you applied thermal paste, sounds stupid but happens a lot.

Read full topic

item.title: PC Temp
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

First what point would there be to lie, second I spelled it wrong because i accidentally added that to my Firefox dictionary once and I don’t know how to remove it so it wont give me the correct spelling, and I don’t really wanna Google it cause it doesn’t matter, my point got to you, you knew what I was saying.

Read full topic

item.title: PC Temp
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

Lol, well, not a spec of dust, just built it a few days ago, the heatsink doesn’t feel hot at all near the top.

also, @magma, it is a dual core, so maybe the 64 is both cores together? idk nething about them though, this is my first dual core pc, so far ive had… Comador 64, acer desktop, and my most recent, dell inspiron b130 laptop.

ambient 0c
